WavePropError documentation

WavePropError is a hybrid Python and C++ package for simulating wave propagation by solving the the one-dimensional Nwogu’s equation [9].It provides different numerical options and supports diffrent order of flux reconstruction, allowing for comaparative analysis of their accuracy and performance.The numerical solution of the Nwogu’s equation is implemented in C++ for performance, while the Python interface provides a user-friendly way to set up and run simulations.

The package supports four numerical schemes for solving the dispersive Nwogu’s equation:

  • Conservative Staggered Scheme [10, 11, 14]

  • HLLC Scheme (Harten, Lax, van Leer, and Contact) [3, 12]

  • HLL Scheme (Harten-Lax-van Leer) [4]

  • Central Upwind Scheme [2, 6, 7]

Luigi Fraccarollo and Eleuterio F Toro. Experimental and numerical assessment of the shallow water model for two-dimensional dam-break type problems. Journal of hydraulic research, 33(6):843–864, 1995.

[7]

Marcel Zijlema. The role of the Rankine-Hugoniot relations in staggered finite difference schemes for the Shallow Water Equations. Computers & Fluids, 192:104274, 2019.
